alert.note: Alert for Martin; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 28 at 7:34AM EDT until September 28 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Martin and St. Lucie. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to rainbands from Hurricane Ian. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Port Saint Lucie, Walton, Fort Pierce, Stuart, Jupiter Island, Jensen Beach, Palm City, Saint Lucie Nuclear Power Plant, White City, Port Salerno, Fort Pierce Inlet, Hobe Sound, Indrio, Sewall`s Point, North River Shores, Port Saint Lucie River Park, Nettles Island, Witham Field, Saint Lucie West and Indian River Estates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
